title: Ranked in gold but playing low silver and high bronze in normal games.
body:
Pretty self explanatory, I worked my way up through bronze and silver to get into gold. When I play ranked, I play against gold or high silver players. Makes sense. But when I play normal games, I am usually matched up, both, with and against players around silver IV, silver V, Bronze I and Bronze II. I just want to know why.

I  would also like to mention, sometimes when I play normal games, I will play with friends around the low silver and high bronze elo or friends who play mostly ARAM. Maybe that might have something to do with it. I don't know, but please let me know what you think or how you feel. XD

~Peace~

replies.body: Isnt it a great opportunity to farm the hexchest?

Ranked MMR and normal MMR are pretty different. 

>Players have a separate MMR for each queue, each of which evolves independently from the others. This means that your wins and losses in Dominion won’t impact your MMR for Summoner’s Rift.
[Source](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752954-Matchmaking-Guide#q1)

Yuh its why i got matched with plats and golds in norms during season 4 but silvers in ranked. I wasn't playing ranked much at all. People telling me "if you're so good why're you in bronze" pissed me off more than anything. Gotta start in ranked somewhere right ya dick? Lmao
pretty simple, when with lower friends you get lower games, and your mmr mustn't be very high otherwise
